matérielles.  knowledge of gpu, cpu, or ai hardware accelerator architectures. | connaissance des architectures d'accélérateurs matériels de type processeur graphique, unité centrale ou ia.  experience working with frameworks like pytorch, caffe2, tensorflow, onnx, tensorrt | expérience de travail avec des cadres comme pytorch, caffe2, tensorflow, onnx, tensorrt  or ai high performance kernels: experience with cuda programming, openmp / opencl programming or ai hardware accelerator kernel programming. experience in accelerating libraries on ai hardware, similar to cublas, cudnn, cutlass, hip, rocm etc. | noyaux à haute performance pour l'ia : expérience dans la programmation cuda, openmp/opencl ou dans la programmation du noyau d'un accélérateur de matériel d'ia. expérience dans l'accélération de bibliothèques sur du matériel d'ia, comme cublas, cudnn, cutlass, hip, rocm, etc.  or ai compiler: experience with compiler optimizations such as loop optimizations, vectorization, parallelization, hardware specific optimizations such as simd. experience with mlir, llvm, iree, xla, tvm, halide is a plus. | ou compilateur d'ia : expérience dans l`optimisation des compilateurs tels que l`optimisation des boucles, la vectorisation, la parallélisation, l`optimisation spécifique du matériel tel que simd. l'expérience avec mlir, llvm, iree, xla, tvm, halide est un plus.  or ai frameworks: experience in developing training and inference framework components. experience in system performance optimizations such as runtime analysis of latency, memory bandwidth, i/o access, compute utilization analysis and associated tooling development. | ou cadres d'ia : expérience dans le développement de composants de formation et du cadre d'inférence. expérience dans l'optimisation des performances systèmes, telle que l'analyse de la latence, de la largeur de bande de la mémoire, de l'accès aux e/s, de l'analyse de l'utilisation du calcul et du développement d'outils associés.     about meta:  meta builds technologies that help people connect, find communities, and grow businesses. when facebook launched in 2004, it changed the way people connect. apps like messenger, instagram and whatsapp further empowered billions around the world. now, meta is moving beyond 2d screens toward immersive experiences like augmented and virtual reality to help build the next evolution in social technology. people who choose to build their careers by building with us at meta help shape a future that will take us beyond what digital connection makes possible today—beyond the constraints of screens, the limits of distance, and even the rules of physics.

title: Machine Learning Engineer 6797-26
desc: hm note: this hybrid role is three (3) days in office   responsibilities:  creates machine learning models and utilizes data to train models  focuses on analyzing data to find relations between the input and the desired output  understands business objectives and develops models that help achieve them, along with metrics to track their progress  designs and develops machine learning and deep learning systems  runs machine learning tests and experiments  implements appropriate machine learning algorithms   general skills:  experience managing available resources such as hardware, data, and personnel so that deadlines are met  experience analyzing the machine learning algorithms that could be used to solve a given problem and ranking them by their success probability  experience exploring and visualizing data to gain an understanding of it, then identifying differences in data distribution that could affect performance when deploying the model in the real world  experience verifying data quality, and/or ensuring it via data cleaning experience supervising the data acquisition process if more data is needed  experience finding available datasets online that could be used for training  experience defining validation strategies  experience defining the preprocessing or feature engineering to be done on a given dataset  background in statistics and computer programming  a team player with a track record for meeting deadlines, managing competing priorities and client relationship management experience   skills  experience and skill set requirements   all requirements are 'must have':   (15%) deep understanding of machine learning concepts:   proficiency in fundamental machine learning concepts, algorithms, and techniques.  expertise in natural language processing (nlp): knowledge of nlp techniques and models, especially bert and other transformer-based models, for tasks like text classification, sentiment analysis, and language understanding.    (20%) experience with deep learning frameworks:   proficiency in deep learning libraries such as tensorflow or pytorch. experience with implementing, training, and fine-tuning bert models using these frameworks is crucial.    (30%)data preprocessing skills:   ability to perform text preprocessing, tokenization, and understanding of word embeddings.  programming skills: strong programming skills in python, including experience with libraries like numpy, pandas, and scikit-learn.    (20%) model optimization and tuning:   skills in optimizing model performance through hyperparameter tuning and understanding of trade-offs between model complexity and performance.    (15%) understanding of transfer learning:   knowledge of how to leverage pre-trained models like bert for specific tasks and adapt them to custom datasets.

title: Student Programmer
desc: student programmer   atkinsréalis is one of canada's largest private sector nuclear engineering groups. we have been providing a wide range of services to the nuclear industry in canada and around the world since for more than 60 years. we are proud to be the steward of canadian candu nuclear technology and to apply our extensive knowledge to service the bwr/pwr market. our expertise includes nuclear steam plant (nsp) engineering, balance of plant (bop) engineering, plant life management and extension, retube tooling systems, inspection and maintenance services, steam generator replacement, plant equipment refurbishment and retrofits.   as part of the candu engineering and plant design tools team, the successful candidate will have the opportunity to work on advancing the development and deployment of the next generation of candu nuclear plants and on atkinsréalis’ engineering software solutions supporting canada in achieving its netzero goals.   the student programmer will report to the manager of engineering and plant design systems and will be responsible for programming and support of in-house developed software solutions including mytrak, proact, acer's and cmms.. this role will require continuous communication with all project team members, and will be responsible for identifying, planning and implementing various scopes of work.   location – mississauga, on   your role within the team:   summary of position:   the role of the student programmer is to carry out mainstream applications development and modifications to individual programs or components of programs/subsystems. this role profile operates within the engineering systems division of the atkinsréalis nuclear group.  key deliverables of incumbents who work within the student programmer role profile include:        reviewing system requirements and business processes, to modify and/or develop software applications programs from detailed specifications.  coding, testing, debugging documenting and implementing software applications and maintaining such programs.  developing program logic for new applications or analyzing and modifying logic in existing applications.  providing application software development services or technical support typically in a defined project.  devising or modifying procedures to solve complex problems considering computer equipment capacity and limitations, operating time and form of desired results.  analyzing requirements and maintaining, testing and integrating applications components.    responsibilities:   develop and/or configure and deliver information systems. this could include commercial off-the-shelf software, outsourced custom builds or in-house developed solutions.  competently works on programming activities.  manages source code, applying defined code management, configuration management and change control processes, and adheres to software development methodologies, standards, and toolsets currently in use.  develops code as it relates to enhancements and new build efforts based on system requirements specifications. responsible for reviewing own code as part of the code review process.  prepares required technical documentation (detailed technical design documents, unit test plans) according to established software development methodologies and standards.  participates in quality assurance activities, including preparation of test plans/cases, executing unit, system and integration testing, and documenting defects in collaboration with the project team.  provides second level production support for the existing portfolio base, liaising with business users and vendor support as required.     why choose atkinsréalis as an employer?   because we offer:   the opportunity to work on various major projects for internal and external clients.  an exciting environment where work-life balance is important.  a wide array of learning and development opportunities.  competitive pay, flexible benefits, an employee share plan, and a defined contribution pension plan.  a work environment focused on health and safety.    the ideal candidate:   enrolled in a recognized educational institution in computer programming.  demonstrated use of asp.net, c#, jquery, javascript and ms sql to build data driven web applications.  demonstrated understanding of the software development lifecycle, development methodologies, and analysis and design techniques and ability to apply these principles over the entire lifecycle of an information system delivery.  demonstrated understanding of software testing techniques and toolsets.  can accurately estimate development efforts.  effective oral and written communication skills. must be able to communicate effectively.    are you up for this challenge? apply today and join our team to help engineer a better future for our planet and its people.   at atkinsréalis, we seek to hire individuals with diverse characteristics, backgrounds, and perspectives. we strongly believe that world-class talent makes no distinctions based on gender, ethnic or national origin, sexual identity and orientation, age, religion, or disability, but enriches itself through these differences.   atkinsréalis cares about your privacy. atkinsréalis and other subsidiary or affiliated companies of atkinsréalis (referred to throughout as “atkinsréalis”) are committed to protecting your privacy. please consult our privacy notice on our careers site to know more about how we collect, use, and transfer your personal data.   by submitting your personal information to atkinsréalis, you confirm that you have read and accept our privacy notice.   appropriate accommodations will be provided upon request throughout the recruitment and hiring process as required by company policy and the accessibility for ontarians with disabilities act (aoda).   successful applicants will be notified about atkinsréalis’ accommodation policies at the time the employment offer is extended, and the information will be shared with new personnel during the onboarding process.

title: Senior Cloud Support Engineer - SQL
desc: build the future of data. join the snowflake team.   snowflake support is committed to providing high-quality resolutions to help deliver data-driven business insights and results. we are a team of subject matter experts collectively working toward our customers’ success. we form partnerships with customers by listening, learning, and building connections.  snowflake’s values are key to our approach and success in delivering world-class support. putting customers first, acting with integrity, owning initiative and accountability, and getting it done are snowflake core values and are reflected in everything we do.  snowflake’s support team is expanding! we are looking for a senior cloud support engineer who likes working with data and solving a wide variety of issues utilizing their technical experience having worked on a variety of operating systems, database technologies, big data, data integration, connectors, and networking.  as a senior cloud support engineer, your role is to delight our customers with your passion and knowledge of snowflake data warehouse. customers will look to you for technical guidance and for expert advice with regards to their effective and optimal use of snowflake. you will be the voice of the customer into snowflake’s product and engineering teams for product feedback and improvements. you will play an integral role in building knowledge within the team and be part of strategic initiatives for organizational and process improvements.  based on business needs, you may be assigned to work with one or more snowflake priority support customers. you will develop a strong understanding of the customer’s use case and how they leverage the snowflake platform. you will deliver exceptional service, enabling them to achieve the highest levels of continuity and performance from their snowflake implementation.  ideally, you have worked in a 24x7 environment, handled technical case escalations and incident management, worked in technical support for an rdbms, been on-call during weekends, and are familiar with database release management.   you will:   drive technical solutions to complex problems providing in-depth analysis and guidance to snowflake customers and partners using the following methods of communication: email, web, and phone adhere to response and resolution slas and escalation processes in order to ensure fast resolution of customer issues that exceed expectations utilize the snowflake environment, connectors, 3rd party partner software, and tools to investigate issues document known solutions to internal and external knowledge base submit well-documented bugs and feature requests arising from customer submitted requests partner with engineering teams in prioritizing and resolving customer requests participate in incident management and on-call rotation participate in a variety of support initiatives provide support coverage during holidays and weekends based on business needs   our ideal senior cloud support engineer will have:   bachelor’s. or master’s degree in computer science or equivalent discipline 5+ years experience in a technical support environment or a similar technical function in a customer-facing role understanding of data warehousing fundamentals and concepts ability to debug, rewrite, and troubleshoot complex sql queries for achieving workarounds or better solutions strong knowledge of rdbms, sql data types, aggregations, and functions including analytical/window functions good understanding of rdbms query profiles and execution plans to analyze query performance and make recommendations for improvement good understanding of database query lifecycle and internal join processing database migration and etl experience scripting/coding experience in any programming language familiarity with semi-structured data experience in rdbms workload management and database performance good understanding of any of the major cloud service provider’s ecosystem ability to interpret systems performance metrics (cpu, i/o, ram, network stats) experience troubleshooting database connectivity issues using a variety of methods (client software, drivers/connectors) understanding of database patch and release management excellent writing and communication skills in english with attention to detail strong teaming skills in a highly collaborative environment and the ability to function in global arenas   nice to haves:   experience working with a distributed database i.e. big data and/or mpp (massively parallel processing) databases. troubleshooting skills on a variety of operating systems (windows, mac, *nix) good understanding of the technical fundamentals of the internet. you should have a solid knowledge of internet protocols such as tcp/ip, http/s, sftp, dns as well as the ability to use diagnostic tools to troubleshoot connectivity issues. understanding of cloud computing security concepts

title: Structural Steel Modeler/Detailer
desc: company description established in 2011 in toronto, ontario, alma engineering is an innovative engineering firm. ranging from 3d modeling, to unique connection, structural and miscellaneous steel design. alma engineering is ready to offer its services on a broad spectrum of projects. alma engineering provides a competitive salary, complete health and dental benefits and annual bonus benefits. job description alma engineering inc. is one of the leading connection design firms within ontario. alma engineering aims to provide accurate and well engineered shop drawings for erection of structural and miscellaneous steel framing, along with detailed fabrication and single part drawings for use during the fabrication process. as a detailer, you will be in charge of modelling structural steel elements based on architectural and engineering drawings. this includes main element modelling, connection modelling, creating detail drawings with sections and details from the manually generated model, preparing drawing sets for use and submission and incorporating alma engineer's general details throughout the process. as alma engineering has grown exponentially over the years, we are looking to expand our drafting team with strong and efficient individuals looking to partake in preparation of detailed steel drawings. a structural steel modeler’s role is to effectively produce accurate and complete detail drawings for structural and miscellaneous steel, within the estimated time as set out by the project plan. to qualify for this position:  strong knowledge of steel detailing. working knowledge of digital drafting software. ability to read and interpret design drawings. must have strong computer skills. will work well with each staff person, be likeable and humble in approach. strong written / verbal communications skills in the english language within the drafting team.  key responsibility areas:  read and interpret design drawings. use a series of available softwares for detailing, modeling and design. create erection drawings with all relevant information for approver and site installer. attention to details specifically within the changes and revisions to existing drawing. ensuring that completed drawings have been reviewed and comply with companies’ fabrication and erection needs (as per contract). double check steel member information by referencing back to contract drawings. create and maintain standard connection details to ensure easy assembly on site. managing the preparation and coordination of assembly drawings and erection plans. draft concise rfi’s if further information / clarification is needed. implement design impacts for changes issued through si’s and ccn’s. ability to work off most up to date information, staying on top of incoming revisions. to be knowledgeable in all facets of your own projects.  job type: full-time salary: $55,000.00-$75,000.00 per year benefits:  casual dress company events dental care disability insurance extended health care flexible schedule on-site parking paid time off  flexible language requirement:  french not required  schedule:  8 hour shift monday to friday  supplemental pay types:  bonus pay  work location: in person

title: Senior Air Engineer
desc: are you an engineer interested in taking on the challenge of being an environmental regulator in the area of air emissions and air pollution control? then we have just the opportunity for you at the ministry of the environment, conservation and parks.     ops commitment to diversity, inclusion, accessibility, and anti-racism: we are committed to build a workforce that reflects the communities we serve and to promote a diverse, anti-racist, inclusive, accessible, merit-based, respectful and equitable workplace.     we invite all interested individuals to apply and encourage applications from people with disabilities, indigenous, black, and racialized individuals, as well as people from a diversity of ethnic and cultural origins, sexual orientations, gender identities and expressions.     visit the    ops anti-racism policy and the    ops diversity and inclusion blueprint pages to learn more about the ops commitment to advance racial equity, accessibility, diversity, and inclusion in the public service.     we offer employment accommodation across the recruitment process and all aspects of employment consistent with the requirements of ontario's    human rights code. refer to the "how to apply" section if you require a disability-related accommodation.     what can i expect to do in this role? as a senior air engineer, you will:     conduct engineering assessments of applications to ensure proposals comply with government environmental requirements review and evaluate engineering designs and specifications review reports of air emissions and air pollution control technologies provide engineering expertise, technical support and guidance participate in meetings and working groups with various stakeholders   how do i qualify?  mandatory:  you are a professional engineer, licensed with professional engineers ontario (peo).   technical knowledge and skills  you have knowledge of, and experience applying the theories, principles, and practices of atmospheric dispersion modelling, mechanical, and/or environmental engineering and technologies related to air pollution control and air emissions management. you have knowledge of environmental legislation (environmental protection act, environmental assessment act, environmental bill of rights), related regulations, standards, policies, guidelines and trends. you have knowledge of project management and related methodologies. you have computer skills and related knowledge of applicable software for word processing, spreadsheets, presentations, internet, and database applications.   communication, interpersonal and negotiation skills  you have communications skills to explain complex technical information, to prepare technical documentation and provide testimonies at public hearings and other legal proceedings; to prepare briefing notes, correspondence, reports, environmental compliance approvals, renewable energy approvals, presentations and other program related documentation.  you have interpersonal skills to develop and maintain effective working relationships with consultants, industry and municipal representatives, and indigenous communities you have negotiation skills to negotiate terms and conditions of the draft environmental compliance approval with proponents, municipal governments and interest groups and participates in the appeals and/or mediations.  you have negotiation skills to manage contentious issues and resolve conflicts or differences between various stakeholders with conflicting interests   analytical and issues management skills  you have analytical skills to analyze and evaluate semi complex and complex applications and registrations including engineering designs, specifications, studies, reports, calculations and other supporting data/information.  you have issues management skills to identify, address and resolve, or participate in resolving contentious issues.     additional information:     address:    1 english temporary, title: Machine Learning Operations Engineer
desc: job requisition id #                                23wd74039     la traduction en français se trouve plus bas!/the french translation can be found below!       about the digital experience & customer empowerment data science team (dxc-ds)    the dxc-ds team is responsible delivering machine learning features that transform the customer experience for sales, marketing, and customer success functions at autodesk.    we aim to help our customers, through conversation, personalization, and other intelligent features on our platform. our team members work extensively with stakeholders across the company, with significant technology leadership and opportunity for impact. we work in a supportive and collaborative way, applying the latest technology and rigorous analysis to solve complex customer problems using ml.    our 2024 focus is on the autodesk assistant, an llm-driven, universal chatbot intended to provide generative answers to a wide range of our customers’ inquiries. this system is in production and already driving rich customer conversations and better outcomes. other examples of our work include models for routing customer queries to agents, designing effective scripts for our support chatbot, and measuring the impact of automation on customer forums.     position overview    the ml ops engineering team combines software engineering with ml system deployment and operations. as an ml ops engineer on the team, you will be responsible for automating and simplifying machine learning workflows and deployments. ml ops engineers work to implement and deliver ml capabilities to solve complex real-world problems and deliver value to our customers. these processes include model development, testing, integration, release, and infrastructure management.    our team culture is built on collaboration, mutual support, and continuous learning. in this role, you will automate and standardize processes across the ml lifecycle, collaborating with data scientists, software engineers, and other cross-functional stakeholders. we emphasize an agile, hands-on, and technical approach at all levels of the team. as a group, we want to continuously improve our work and knowledge of trends and techniques relevant to our areas.    we strive for excellence and pursue it with personal development and knowledge sharing.    location: toronto or montreal, canada     responsibilities           you will design and implement streamlined end-to-end, continuous, and automated process of deploying, monitoring, and maintaining versioned ml models, at scale.            you will design and implement services, tests, and interfaces to support machine learning capabilities that improve autodesk’s ecommerce & customer platforms.            you will design and implement data pipelines and automated workflows to operationalize data at different stages of the machine learning lifecycle.            collaborate with other members of the team to reach better solutions, and to position our team at the cutting edge of technology and ml practice.            deploy innovative solutions from non-production environments to production with an eye on scalability and observability.           minimum qualifications           bs or ms in computer science, statistics, engineering, economics, or related field      we also welcome applicants from non-traditional ml backgrounds.         0-3 years of applicable work experience in software engineering or data engineering or ml engineering            proficiency with the python machine learning stack, e.g., pandas, etc.            demonstrate expertise with applying machine learning, including both deep learning (pytorch) and classical ml (scikit-learn)           preferred qualifications           familiarity with large language models, especially in the context of interactive dialog systems and chatbots (rag, generative ai, conversational agents)            experience deploying systems that use nlp or experience working with conversational ai frameworks            sql and experience with big data technology such as hive, presto, glue, (py)spark, or athena            experience with data pipelines and the aws ml ecosystem            strong software engineering skills           #li-post        -       23wd74039 ingénieur(e) en opérations d’apprentissage automatique        à propos de l’expérience numérique et de l’équipe de développement des données (dxc-ds)    l'équipe dxc-ds est responsable de fournir des fonctionnalités d'apprentissage automatique qui transforment l'expérience client pour les fonctions de vente, de marketing et de réussite client chez autodesk.    notre objectif est d'aider nos clients, par le biais de conversations, de la personnalisation et d'autres fonctionnalités intelligentes sur notre plateforme. les membres de notre équipe travaillent en étroite collaboration avec les parties prenantes de l'ensemble de l'entreprise, ce qui leur permet d'exercer un leadership technologique important et de créer des opportunités d’impact. nous travaillons de manière solidaire et collaborative en appliquant les plus récentes technologies et une analyse rigoureuse pour résoudre des problèmes complexes de nos clients à l’aide de l’apprentissage automatique.    en 2024, nous nous concentrons sur autodesk assistant, un agent conversationnel universel fondé sur les llm, destiné à fournir des réponses génératives à un large éventail de demandes de nos clients. ce système est en production et permet déjà d’enrichir les conversations avec les clients et d’obtenir de meilleurs résultats. parmi les autres exemples de notre travail, citons les modèles d'acheminement des demandes des clients vers les agents, la conception de scripts efficaces pour notre agent conversationnel d'assistance et la mesure de l'impact de l'automatisation sur les forums de clients.     présentation du poste    l’équipe d’ingénierie en opérations d’apprentissage automatique combine le génie logiciel avec le déploiement et l’opération de systèmes d’apprentissage automatique. en tant qu’ingénieur(e) en opérations d’apprentissage automatique au sein de l’équipe, vous serez responsable de l’automatisation et de la simplification des déploiements et des flux de travaux de l’apprentissage automatique. les ingénieurs en opérations d’apprentissage automatique travaillent à la mise en œuvre et à la livraison de capacités d’apprentissage automatique pour résoudre des problèmes complexes du monde réel et offrir une valeur ajoutée à nos clients. ces processus incluent le développement de modèles, les tests, l’intégration, le lancement et la gestion d’infrastructures.    notre culture d’équipe repose sur la collaboration, le soutien mutuel et l’apprentissage continu. dans ce rôle, vous allez automatiser et standardiser les processus tout au long du cycle de vie de l’apprentissage automatique, en collaborant avec les experts en sciences des données, les développeurs de logiciels et d’autres parties prenantes interfonctionnelles. nous mettons l’accent sur une approche agile, pratique et technique à tous les niveaux de l’équipe. en tant que groupe, nous souhaitons améliorer continuellement notre travail et notre connaissance des tendances et des techniques pertinentes pour nos domaines.    nous nous efforçons d’atteindre l’excellence et la recherchons par le développement personnel et le partage des connaissances.    emplacement : toronto ou montréal, canada       responsabilités           vous allez concevoir et mettre en œuvre un processus de bout en bout, continu et automatisé rationalisé pour le déploiement, la surveillance et le maintien à grande échelle des modèles d’apprentissage automatique versionnés.            vous allez concevoir et implémenter des services, des tests et des interfaces pour prendre en charge les capacités d’apprentissage automatique qui améliorent les plateformes de commerce en ligne et client d’autodesk.            vous allez concevoir et implémenter des pipelines de données et des flux de travaux automatisés pour rendre opérationnelles les données à différentes étapes du cycle de vie de l’apprentissage automatique.            vous collaborerez avec d’autres membres de l’équipe pour trouver de meilleures solutions et positionner notre équipe à la pointe de la technologie et des pratiques de l’apprentissage automatique            vous déploierez des solutions innovantes, depuis les environnements hors production jusqu’à la production, en gardant à l’esprit l’évolutivité et l’observabilité.           exigences minimales           baccalauréat ou maîtrise en informatique, en statistique, en ingénierie, en économie ou dans un domaine connexe      nous souhaitons également la bienvenue aux candidats issus de milieux non traditionnels en apprentissage automatique         0 à 3 ans d’expérience professionnelle applicable en génie logiciel, en ingénierie des données ou en ingénierie de l’apprentissage automatique            maîtrise de la pile python machine learning, par exemple pandas, etc.            faire preuve d’expérience de l’application de l’apprentissage automatique, y compris l’apprentissage profond (pytorch) et l’apprentissage automatique classique (scikit-learn)           compétences souhaitées           connaissance des grands modèles de langage, notamment dans le contexte des systèmes de dialogue interactif et des agents conversationnels (rag, ia générative, agents de conversation)            expérience dans le déploiement de systèmes utilisant le traitement du langage naturel ou l’utilisation de structures d’ia de conversation            expérience en sql et avec les technologies de données massives comme hive, presto, glue, (py)spark ou athena            expérience avec les pipelines de données et l’écosystème d’apprentissage automatique d’aws            solides compétences en title: software engineer
desc: education: bachelor's degree experience: 1 year to less than 2 years or equivalent experience  tasks  collect and document user's requirements and develop logical and physical specifications  research, evaluate and synthesize technical information to design, develop and test computer-based systems  develop data, process and network models to optimize architecture and to evaluate the performance and reliability of designs  plan, design and co-ordinate the development, installation, integration and operation of computer-based systems  assess, troubleshoot, document, upgrade and develop maintenance procedures for operating systems, communications environments and applications software  lead and co-ordinate teams of information systems professionals in the development of software and integrated information systems, process control software and other embedded software control systems  execute and document results of software application tests and information and telecommunication systems tests  conduct tests and perform security and quality controls  health benefits  health care plan  long term benefits  other benefits  other benefits  paid time off (volunteering or personal days) work term: permanent work language: english hours: 30 to 40 hours per week

title: full stack architect
desc: summary: we are looking for a highly motivated and experienced generative ai full stack architect to join our team in usa. you will be responsible for the design, development, and deployment of generative ai models and systems that will power our next-generation products and services. you will work closely with a team of talented engineers and scientists to push the boundaries of what is possible with generative ai. responsibilities:  design, develop, and deploy generative ai models and systems across the full stack, from data pipelines to front-end applications. collaborate with data scientists, machine learning engineers, and software engineers to define and execute the technical roadmap for generative ai projects. lead the architecture and design of generative ai systems, ensuring scalability, performance, and reliability. develop and implement best practices for generative ai model development, deployment, and monitoring. stay up-to-date on the latest advancements in generative ai research and apply them to our products and services. communicate effectively with technical and non-technical stakeholders to ensure alignment on generative ai initiatives.   design generative ai models and outputs seamlessly into user interfaces. stay up-to-date on the latest front-end frameworks and libraries (e.g., react, vue.js, angular) and apply them to generative ai projects. optimize front-end performance and responsiveness for various platforms and devices. collaborate with designers and ui/ux experts to ensure a consistent and intuitive user experience. design robust and scalable back-end apis for generative ai models.   implement efficient data pipelines to feed data to and extract outputs from generative ai models. choose and optimize backend technologies (e.g., python, java, node.js) based on model requirements and system limitations. ensure the security and reliability of generative ai systems in production.  qualifications:  master's degree or bachelor’s degree in computer science, machine learning, or a related field, or equivalent experience. 12+ years of experience in software engineering, with a focus on full-stack development. 4+ years of experience with generative ai models and techniques, such as gans, vaes, and autoregressive models. strong understanding of deep learning frameworks, such as tensorflow, pytorch, or mxnet. excellent communication, collaboration, and problem-solving skills. ability to work independently and as part of a team. strong passion for generative ai and its potential to transform the world.  job type: full-time pay: $160,000.00-$175,000.00 per year schedule:  8 hour shift  education:  bachelor's (required)  experience:  software engineering: 10 years (required) full-stack development: 10 years (required) generative ai models and techniques: 5 years (required) tensorflow: 10 years (preferred) pytorch, or mxnet: 10 years (preferred)  willingness to travel:  100% (required)

title: Field Engineer - Transmission Lines
desc: reporting to the project manager, the field engineer will be required to provide coordination and technical direction to construction and engineering resources on project design.what you'll do here:  responsible for the organization and direction of construction engineering personnel and activities relating to construction engineering and subcontracts provides technical direction to construction engineers and superintendents in a wide range of construction engineering and design functions relating to multi-discipline engineering in an area or to a single discipline on the overall project provides liaison with the design engineering group provides ongoing constructability input to the design group manages the complex organizational interactions that evolve from the project team and the client represents design in respect to major items with suppliers interprets design drawings and specifications resolves technical problems encountered during the construction of the project supervises field verification of materials maintains project document control prepares change notices and amendments as directed monitors the cost and budget performance during construction, as assigned works in conjunction with the site managers in developing and implementing work plans and procedures prepares deficiency reports and corrective action reports for project team performs other duties and responsibilities as required support large ontario utility  what you bring to the table:  bachelor of engineering degree from a recognized university, or diploma from a technical college in engineering and/or architecture licensed as a professional engineer (p.eng) previous work experience in engineering minimum of 5 - 8 years of experience in transmission lines proficient knowledge of project engineering processes and procedures able to perform in a fast-paced environment. comfortable with occasional travel between sites and head office. technical knowledge related to engineering systems, calculations and applications of engineering and construction methods and materials excellent computer skills using adobe acrobat, auto cad and sim good knowledge of microsoft word, excel and outlook excellent communication and negotiation skills able to interact with external stakeholders.  job type: full-time benefits:  dental care life insurance paid time off vision care  experience:  transmission lines: 5 years (required)  licence/certification:  p.eng (required)  ability to commute:  greater toronto area, on (required)  work location: in person

title: System Configuration Specialist
desc: reporting directly to the regional installation manager, the system configuration specialist will be a key member of our team to configure, troubleshoot and maintain all mission critical systems. the individual work in conjunction with project teams and installation resources to ensure programming and configuration requirements are delivered within the project schedule. act as the first line of defense in troubleshooting service requests to remotely diagnose, correct or determine the requirement for the deployment of a service technician.  key responsibilities:   configure, test, maintain, monitor, and troubleshoot end user workstation and servers, hardware, software, networked peripheral devices, cabling and networking hardware and software products  follow and complete maintenance procedural documentation  use and understand the system delivered to the customer  act as an escalation point after-hours for critical troubleshooting requirements.  act as a subject matter expert for all mission critical systems  schedule and perform network and communication improvements, upgrades and repairs  support development and implementation of networking and communication projects and new technology installations  practice network asset management, including maintenance of network and communication component inventory  prepare, maintain, and adhere to procedures for logging, reporting and statistically monitoring network data  test and certify pc, networks, servers and client software applications and associated peripherals  prepare and ensure accuracy of documentation, procedures manuals, and help sheets for network installations, including date, voice, pc and video systems  aid in development of disaster recovery plans, and maintain current knowledge of plan executable. respond to emergency network outages in accordance to business disaster recovery plans  assist the system engineer with drawing draft  perform remote diagnostics and troubleshooting for system issues  advise as to next steps in corrective action when remote fixes do not correct system functionality, including but not limited to patch applications, software plus (telephony/ip/wireless)  proven work experience performing on-site analysis, diagnosis, and resolution of network and communication problems for a variety of end users  implement corrective hardware and software solutions  must have strong communication skills; verbal, written, and analytical

title: Manufacturing Engineer
desc: location: multimatic inmet, richmond hill, ontario, canada  multimatic inmet manufactures fully engineered, high-quality components, assemblies and systems such as bumpers and chassis/body structural components for high-volume vehicle manufacturers.  multimatic inmet is currently looking for a manufacturing engineer that will be responsible for increasing company profitability and improving employee working conditions by studying, recommending and implementing changes to existing and new manufacturing processes. they will also be accountable for collaborating with program managers on new and existing program engineering requirements and process development.  key responsibilities:  develop and co-ordinate plant and equipment layout improvements, process improvements, to prepare company for just-in-time manufacturing and tqc (total quality control) assist in developing and maintaining standard costs for all products co-ordinate and follow up on the smooth introduction of new product to the company assist in selecting appropriate suppliers for subcontracted operations research and pursue any potential operational opportunities for improvement in the company's operation to make the company competitive in a jit manufacturing environment. advise management of any potential problems and opportunities for improvement assist with any other projects as requested by the lead manufacturing engineer participates in the engineering change (ecn) process by designing / updating process failure mode effects analyses (pfmeas) as needed, reviewing all operators instructions, ensuring assembly equipment readiness, packaging requirements are met, and all other process engineering tasks are completed on the ecn checklist before the change effective date maintains regular daily presence on the production floor and provides engineering support to assembly in areas of safety, ergonomic evaluations, methods improvement, procurement and fabrication of necessary equipment to improve/complete any required process additions and/or alterations, and responding to their concerns/suggestions consider all aspects of industrial plant engineering when designing and/or implementing process changes research, investigate and report manufacturing problems/concerns for improvement implementing corrective actions to minimize process downtimes and rejected parts works in compliance with iatf16949, io14001, and legislative requirements of the ohsa  qualifications:  college diploma or university degree in industrial or mechanical engineering minimum (3) three years’ experience in a related field or discipline, experience with welded assemblies an asset good knowledge of manufacturing, processes, production reporting strong technical report writing abilities. excellent problem solving techniques and methods. ability to successfully interact with all levels of employees in the organization. computer skills in the area of ms office, and cad (solidworks) must be able to work independently and prioritize tasks excellent verbal and written communication skills experience in a high-volume manufacturing environment strong attention to detail and accuracy  multimatic inmet offers a competitive salary, comprehensive benefits package, as well as a friendly work environment.  if you are interested in this exciting opportunity, please apply with a copy of your resume, and cover letter stating salary expectations.  if you are interested in this position, apply by sending us your cover letter and resume. we thank all interested candidates in advance; however, only individuals selected for interviews will be contacted. as part of our commitment to ensuring our employment practices are fair, accessible, and inclusive of persons with disabilities, recruitment-related accommodations for disabilities, are available upon request throughout the recruitment and assessment process for applicants with disabilities.

title: QA Automation Engineer
desc: about us  at port 443 we work together, laugh together, and eat a lot of donuts together. (have you seen our instagram? it’s basically a food blog.)  our products (my music staff, tutorbird & athletadesk) are always evolving, making for an exciting and dynamic environment. every day, we’re connecting with thousands of users all around the world. if you ask what they love about us, they’ll tell you that we really listen to their needs and go above and beyond to help them. our members are at the heart of everything we do. their feedback and ideas help to shape our products, and at the end of the day, we’re here because of them…  …and because of the donuts.  about you  you’re a motivated self-starter with a passion for quality and software testing. you’re quick to learn new things, and you’ll be ready to hit the ground running, figuratively and literally – we have a treadmill desk at the office! you love to solve problems (and you’re good at it ). you’re a strong communicator who can mentor others. you’ve got a good sense of humour – feel free to tell us your most groan-worthy g-rated joke in your job application for bonus points!  you’ve got:  degree or diploma in computer science, software engineering, or a related field strong expertise in qa methodologies and industry best practices proven experience with automated testing frameworks such as selenium, testng, or junit proficiency in object-oriented programming (oop) principles and concepts hands-on experience in java programming exposure to restful/api automation proven troubleshooting and problem-solving abilities, particularly in addressing customer-reported issues familiarity with continuous integration/continuous deployment (ci/cd) practices  you’ll stand out if you’ve also got experience with:  security and performance testing mobile automation frameworks like appium docker and kubernetes  your responsibilities will include:  collaborating with internal teams to grasp product requirements for effective testing developing thorough and organized test plans and scenarios encompassing automated and manual tests strategizing and orchestrating testing activities in collaboration with different internal teams conducting manual testing to validate the accuracy of product functionality automating tests whenever feasible to optimize efficiency detecting, investigating, and meticulously documenting any identified issues or defects     meet the qa team!  ojas is our software developer in test, or as we like to think of him… our bug exterminator! he spends his days developing and performing tests on our products to uncover any bugs or issues for the team to fix before deploying changes. he’s also an absolute ray of sunshine who brings such a positive energy into the office! even the most pessimistic team members can’t help but smile when ojas is around  todd has the perfect dad joke for every conversation and the best track record on untappd! as qa analyst & it coordinator, he handles escalated bugs, tries to “break” pre-release features (so we can fix them, of course!), aaaaand deals with any incidents involving coffee spills & laptops you can always count on todd for his quick wit, rapid-fire puns, and impressive bowling skills at our annual bowling bash!  other perks/benefits  free snacks and coffee – are you team hazelnut or team regular? company social events throughout the year – significant others welcome! cool company swag when we reach milestones – check our ig to see some of our past swag comprehensive health benefits plan – now you can stop putting off that dentist appointment!  when you come to work at port 443, you’re joining a team that balances innovation, excellence, and fun. if this sounds like the perfect fit for you, we want to hear why! to let us know why this job posting speaks to you and what you can bring to the table, send your cover letter, resume, and favourite donut flavour to careers@port443.io  p.s. a real human person reviews all submissions, so let your personality shine through!

title: Machine Learning Engineer - Senior
desc: dawn infotek inc. is a professional it consulting team that partners with major financial institutions, investment firms and government sectors. we have been dedicated to delivering cutting-edge consulting services and recruiting all levels of it positions for our clients. responsibilities:  creates machine learning models and utilizes data to train models focuses on analyzing data to find relations between the input and the desired output understands business objectives and develops models that help achieve them, along with metrics to track their progress designs and develops machine learning and deep learning systems runs machine learning tests and experiments implements appropriate machine learning algorithms  general skills:   experience managing available resources such as hardware, data, and personnel so that deadlines are met experience analyzing the machine learning algorithms that could be used to solve a given problem and ranking them by their success probability experience exploring and visualizing data to gain an understanding of it, then identifying differences in data distribution that could affect performance when deploying the model in the real world experience verifying data quality, and/or ensuring it via data cleaning experience supervising the data acquisition process if more data is needed experience finding available datasets online that could be used for training experience defining validation strategies experience defining the preprocessing or feature engineering to be done on a given dataset background in statistics and computer programming a team player with a track record for meeting deadlines, managing competing priorities and client relationship management experience  must haves:  deep understanding of machine learning concepts: proficiency in fundamental machine learning concepts, algorithms, and techniques. expertise in natural language processing (nlp): knowledge of nlp techniques and models, especially bert and other transformer-based models, for tasks like text classification, sentiment analysis, and language understanding. experience with deep learning frameworks: proficiency in deep learning libraries such as tensorflow or pytorch. experience with implementing, training, and fine-tuning bert models using these frameworks is crucial. data preprocessing skills: ability to perform text preprocessing, tokenization, and understanding of word embeddings. programming skills: strong programming skills in python, including experience with libraries like numpy, pandas, and scikit-learn. model optimization and tuning: skills in optimizing model performance through hyperparameter tuning and understanding of trade-offs between model complexity and performance. understanding of transfer learning: knowledge of how to leverage pre-trained models like bert for specific tasks and adapt them to custom datasets.  job type: fixed term contract salary: $60.00-$75.00 per hour schedule:  monday to friday  experience:  natural language processing (nlp):: 2 years (required) deep learning libraries such as tensorflow or pytorch: 2 years (required)  work location: hybrid remote in toronto, on m5g 1s5

title: Director, Technical Cloud Operations
desc: company description  a career that’s the whole package!  at conga, we’ve built a community where our colleagues can thrive. here you’ll find opportunities to innovate, support for growth through individual and team development, and an environment where all voices can be heard.  conga crushes complexity within an increasingly complex world. with our revenue lifecycle management solution, we transform your unique complexities for order configuration, execution, fulfillment, and contract renewal processes with a single critical insights data model that adapts to ever-changing business requirements and aligns the understanding and efforts of every team.  our mission: empower customers to deliver transformational revenue growth by aligning teams, processes, and technology to maximize customer lifetime value.  our approach is grounded in the conga way, a framework for what we stand for and everything we do as an organization — from hiring to decision making and product development. developed with direct input from our colleagues, the conga way is the foundation for our culture.  job description  reports to: senior director, cloud operations  a quick snapshot…  as the director of technical cloud operations, you’ll be responsible for managing the health and reliability of conga’s cloud infrastructure and production systems while managing a team of reliability engineers. you’ll help design, build, operate, and own overall technical relationships between multiple stakeholders within our organization. you’ll provide insight and support into the operations and implementation of new initiatives to continue to drive efficiency.  why it’s a big deal…  conga’s cloud operations team has a culture unlike any other. we are fun, collaborative, passionate, and driven. we invest in our team and a variety of technical initiatives and innovations. you’ll have the opportunity to drive improvements in efficiencies by adopting cutting-edge technologies supporting the success of conga.  are you the person we are looking for?  related experience. you have 12 or more years of experience as an architect or lead engineer, with at least 5 years focused on cloud architecture and/or leading an operations team. you have deep expertise and a track record of managing cloud infrastructure solutions on the azure, aws, or ibm platforms and a deep understating of cloud computing (network principles, iaas, paas, and saas cloud delivery models). you know how to design and implement strategic roadmaps for cloud solutions, migrations, greenfield applications, and cloud-native deployments for medium and large enterprises. you collect requirements, design plans, and build solutions to constantly improve availability, performance, scalability, uptime, and response times. you define technical milestones and develop capex/opex cost models with an emphasis on cloud maturity modeling. you’ve also gained knowledge across other disciplines, including web applications, networks, databases, and security.  resourceful & collaborative. you lead with collaboration. you know how to ensure clear lines of communication with engineering teams, business partners, technical and operational leaders, and peer architects in other departments. you’ve built processes to guarantee everyone is on the same page and has unified architectural and capability assumptions. you’ve built strong partnerships with information security teams to ensure best-in-class security solutions.  leadership. you enjoy being a mentor to your colleagues. you’re a champion for best practices and infrastructure as code adoption. you’re confident as a subject matter expert on cloudops and devops best practices with cloud development groups, configuration management, etc.  here is what will give you an edge…  analytical thinker and creative problem solver. you are able to see issues holistically and follow the flow of the stack to get to the root of the matter - a key skill in this role. but where you really shine is with your ability to identify creative solutions to unique customer requirements. this is critical for ensuring our customer issues are resolved in a manner that meets or exceeds their expectations without increasing their costs.  education. successful completion of a bachelor of computer science, management information systems, or related field is highly preferred.   did we pique your interest?  if this sounds like the kind of job you would love in the kind of environment where you would thrive, please click apply. we'd love to hear from you!  don’t meet every requirement for the role?  studies have shown that women and members of ethnic minorities are less likely to apply to jobs unless they meet every single qualification. at conga we are dedicated to building a diverse, inclusive, and authentic workplace, so if you’re excited about this role but your experience doesn’t align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyway. you just might be the right candidate for this or other roles.  #bi-remote  #li-mf1  additional information  conga is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants regardless of race, color, religion, gender, gender identity, age, national origin, disability, parental or pregnancy status, marriage and civil partnership, sexual orientation, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. reasonable accommodations will be made to meet the requirements of the americans with disabilities act and will be provided as requested by candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. all your information will be kept confidential according to eeo guidelines. conga is not open to third party solicitation or resumes for our posted fte positions. resumes received from third party agencies that are unsolicited will be considered complimentary.

title: Cybersecurity Platform Engineer
desc: company description  canada goose isn't like anything else. we've built something great, something special - an iconic lifestyle brand with an inspirational and authentic story. at the heart of it is our promise to inspire and enable all people to thrive in the world outside. to live in the open. at canada goose, you're part of a movement that belongs to something bigger. one that seeks out the restorative power of nature and is driven by a purpose to keep the planet cold and the people on it warm. we endure any condition, observe every detail, and are building a community that believes in living bravely and coming together to support game-changing people.  here, opportunities are everywhere - to try something new, to learn, to do meaningful and impactful work, and they're yours for the taking.  job description  the cybersecurity platform engineer will play a key role in designing, implementing, and managing our cybersecurity platforms to ensure the highest level of security for canada goose. along with a deep understanding of cybersecurity principles, hands-on experience with security technologies, and the ability to collaborate effectively with multi-functional teams.  to ensure success, a cyber security engineer must display a solid grasp of technology infrastructures using firewalls, vpn, data loss prevention, ids/ips, web-proxy, and security audits with meticulous attention to detail, outstanding problem-solving skills, work comfortably under pressure, and deliver on tight deadlines.  what you’ll do:   researching, planning, implementing, managing, optimizing, and monitoring security platforms for the protection of the organization's data, systems, and networks with an emphasis on automation  be a hands-on subject matter expert for security platforms such as firewalls, ids/ips, casb and edr  participate in incident response activities, including the identification, analysis, and mitigation of security incidents  ensuring that the organization's data and infrastructure are protected by enabling the appropriate security controls.  align security measures with business objectives and to effectively communicate complex security concepts  stay current with the latest industry trends, emerging threats, and advancements in security technologies  contributing to proactive research and analysis of identifying network and system vulnerabilities.  daily administrative tasks, reporting, and communication with the relevant departments in the organization.   let's talk about you:   post-secondary education in computer science, information technology, cybersecurity, or other it-related field of study  microsoft m365 and azure security certifications preferred alongside other industry standards  5+ years of experience working in a cyber security-related role with 3+ years managing cybersecurity enterprise tools & platforms  good understanding of application security concepts and controls  soc experience a strong asset  background in it systems & network administration  excellent understanding of it security controls, technologies, and processes  experience administering endpoint detection and response (edr), single sign on (sso), cloud access security broker (casb), firewalls, vulnerability management, m365 & azure security and security information and event management (siem)  proficiency in python, c++, java, ruby, node, go, and/or power shell.  strong attention to detail with an analytical mind and outstanding problem-solving skills.  great awareness of cybersecurity trends and hacking techniques.  demonstrate pro-active individual effectiveness and within team-oriented, collaborative environments    additional information  all your information will be kept confidential according to eeo guidelines.   what’s in it for you?   a company built on canadian roots and heritage  your work is recognized with a comprehensive and competitive total rewards program  opportunities for career growth through numerous internal and external programs  recognize and be recognized by your peers with our goose rewards & icon rewards  be a part of cg gives. donation matching and paid volunteer time to help the organizations you care about  access to tools and resources to support physical and mental health, embracing change and connecting with colleagues  inspiring leaders and colleagues who will lift you up and help you grow   we believe in the power of inclusion and are passionate about building and sustaining an inclusive and equitable working environment where all employees can bring their authentic selves to work everyday. we believe every one of our team members enriches our diversity by exposing us to varying ways to understand the world, identify challenges, and to discover, design, produce, and deliver great products and service. our different perspectives are what enable us to create, dream and live in the open.  canada goose is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to providing employment accommodation in accordance with the ontario human rights code and the accessibility for ontarians with disabilities act.  there are multiple ways to interview with us! if you require any interview accommodation for your interview, please e-mail us at hr@canadagoose.com.

title: Machine Learning Engineer, Autodesk Assistant
desc: job requisition id #                                23wd74040     la traduction en français se trouve plus bas!/the french translation can be found below!       about the digital experience & customer empowerment data science team (dxc-ds)       the dxc-ds team is responsible delivering machine learning features that transform the customer experience for sales, marketing, and customer success functions at autodesk.        we aim to help our customers, through conversation, personalization, and other intelligent features on our platform. our team members work extensively with stakeholders across the company, with significant technology leadership and opportunity for impact. we work in a supportive and collaborative way, applying the latest technology and rigorous analysis to solve complex customer problems using ml.        our 2024 focus is on the autodesk assistant, an llm-driven, universal chatbot intended to provide generative answers to a wide range of our customers’ inquiries. this system is in production and already driving rich customer conversations and better outcomes. other examples of our work include models for routing customer queries to agents, designing effective scripts for our support chatbot, and measuring the impact of automation on customer forums.        position overview       as a ml engineer on the team, you will be responsible for leading/contributing to the design, analysis, and delivery of data-driven solutions to significant business challenges across a program of work. ml engineers work to deliver ml-driven technical solutions to customer needs in our platform.       reporting to the senior principal mle on the team, this role is hands-on, focusing on technical skills with the latest in nlp and ml technology.       our team culture is built on collaboration, mutual support, and continuous learning. as a mle, you will provide technical guidance and expertise for the team, and with other stakeholders. we emphasize an agile, hands-on, and technical approach at all levels of the team. as a group, we want to continuously improve our machine learning as well as our knowledge of trends and techniques relevant to our areas.       our team strives for excellence in the theory and practice of machine learning. we encourage personal development and knowledge sharing.        location: title: Store Systems Engineer
desc: location: markham, ontario       job description:        job overview       the store systems engineer plays a key role in implementing and maintaining the backend systems that power the company’s in store experience from the point of service system to the handhelds and other devices used in our stores. this individual is passionate about providing quality service to our stores and franchisees, thus ensuring our customers that shop in store have as seamless an experience as possible. the role will report to the manager of store systems and be part of the digital engineering & customer facing technology team within the marketing department. the store systems engineer will be responsible for the following essential duties and is capable of adopting quickly to digital transformation mandates and initiatives. the individual will work collaboratively in cross-functional teams and must communicate effectively with creative teams and clients.        essential duties     maintain and support essential servers and back-end systems that are used in day-to-day retail operations.  perform continuous upgrades in conjunction with developers for our pos software ensuring company rollout standards are adhered to.  level-3 escalation for our pos systems and accompanying back-end servers and programs.  development of proactive monitoring and cleanup scripts to maintain our day-to-day operations and ensure a stable product for the end users. coordinate with helpdesk for escalations of any monitoring put in place and provide them with tools to help better service our customers before relying on escalations.  data analysis for in store and centralized requests utilizing the following but not limited to sql queries, excel, powershell scripting, etc. to pull back required data to assist in in-depth analysis of issues and or data to make a business case to drive future decisions.  works closely with other store systems engineers, ba’s, and the manager to assess the current state of hardware, software, etc. in stores and make recommendations for future upgrades, changes, etc. that would benefit the end users.  performs essential duties related to new store openings, relocations, renovations, store closures, etc. including but not limited to working with 3rd party vendors, installing, and maintaining system images, configuring on site network devices and wireless handhelds, etc.  maintain in-store databases across all stores from an initial support perspective. monitor the databases via proactive scripting, troubleshoot where applicable, and work with internal escalation teams for further analysis where needed.  works closely with ba’s and functional business users to identify future changes and perform poc’s where applicable.  maintains our qa environment in our home office ensuring systems is readily available for the qa team. occasionally will perform qa duties where needed either remotely or in person to help validate scenarios from a technical perspective.       experience, education, certifications     bachelor's or master’s degree in computer science, software engineering, or a related field.  minimum 3 years work experience in a retail environment supporting applicable retail systems.  prior working experience in a helpdesk and or escalation support type role with on-call practices.  ability to analyze complex technical problems and propose effective solutions.  proficient in debugging and troubleshooting issues in a timely manner.  experience with tools like jira, confluence, slack, or others.  effective communication within functional and technical stakeholders.       #corphire

title: Intermediate Numerical Modeler and Data Scientist (Future Hire)
desc: company description  w.f. baird & associates coastal engineers ltd. (baird) provides professional engineering and technical services related to the design of coastal structures and facilities that interact with the world’s oceans, lakes, and rivers. baird is recognized for the successful completion of innovative and practical projects throughout north and south america, the caribbean, middle east, africa, and southeast asia.  we provide a stimulating work environment, with opportunities for domestic and international travel, professional development, and ownership potential within the company. baird is a 100-person engineering firm specializing in coastal, marine, and riverine engineering with offices in the u.s., canada, barbados, chile, and australia. we are one of the only firms in the world dedicated exclusively to marine and coastal projects, and we encourage you to visit our website (www.baird.com) to gain additional insight into our company, capabilities, and experience.  job description  we are currently looking for a dynamic, motivated, and personable numerical modeler & data scientist with a strong background in numerical modeling, data science and data analytics to join our team. the selected candidate will assist a diverse team of international engineers and scientists on a variety of projects and r&d initiatives.  job responsibilities:   background in coastal and riverine processes including wave mechanics, sediment transport and morphology, hydraulics, hydrology, tides, water levels, currents, and water quality.  experience using multi-dimensional numerical models such as the mike and delft software packages, telemac, tomawac, adcirc, swan, stwave, efdc, fvcom, the hec modeling system, swat, wavad, wavewatch3, funwave, flow-3d, openfoam, star-ccm, and reef3d.  application and high level understanding of hydrodynamic, spectral wave and cfd modeling with prior experience with commonly used modeling systems such as: mike, delft, telemac, tomawac, adcirc, swan, stwave, efdc, fvcom, the hec modeling system, swat, wavad, wavewatch3, funwave, flow-3d, openfoam, star-ccm, and reef3d  analyzing datasets to find patterns and create solutions. knowledge of statistics for effective problem-solving in the domain of coastal engineering.  experience with software such as paraview, blender, tecplot or other tools to support visualization and processing of model inputs and outputs.  interpreting and presenting results in a clear manner. propose solutions and strategies to address complex challenges.  strong communication skills to present complex findings to both technical and non-technical audiences.  ability to work in a team environment with clients, internal technical groups, and business development teams.    qualifications    degree in civil engineering, computer science, mathematics, or similar field.  master’s degree or phd in coastal engineering, computer science, mathematics is an asset.  registered with or have ability to register as a professional engineer is beneficial but not required.  a minimum of five years of numerical modeling experience in a coastal or water resource role.  experience with data science and numerical modelling  experience with cad, arc-gis, and ms office software an asset but not required.  willingness to travel both domestically and internationally for 1 to 2-week periods as required.   competencies:  client relationships – you communicate (written and verbal) with impact, build relationships with an open mind, and are passionate about client service excellence.  communication skills – excellent interpersonal, verbal, and written communication skills (english).  analytical skills – ability to break down problems and pull together data, ideas, issues, and observations into a clear and useful format.  initiative – ability to react and anticipate potential problems and provide clear, concise recommendations to resolve them.  teamwork – ability to share information and knowledge freely, offering support and cooperation.  additional information   baird is an equal-opportunity employer. all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, national origin, protected veteran status, disability, genetics, or citizenship status (when otherwise legally authorized to work) and will not be discriminated against based on such characteristics or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where baird operates.  we thank all candidates for their interest. baird is a diverse and inclusive workplace that is welcoming to all backgrounds and walks of life. we encourage you to apply even if you don't match all of our job requirements!  disclaimer: the above information in this description has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed by employees with this classification. it is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities, and qualifications required of employees assigned to this position.  baird is an equal-opportunity employer. all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, national origin, protected veteran status, disability, genetics, or citizenship status (when otherwise legally authorized to work) and will not be discriminated against based on such characteristics or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where baird operates.  we thank all candidates for their interest. baird is a diverse and inclusive workplace that is welcoming to all backgrounds and walks of life. we encourage you to apply even if you don't match all of our job requirements!  disclaimer: the above information in this description has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed by employees with this classification. it is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties,
